content.description: Sit-start as for "Never Never Will I Ever" then head right on crimps and top out with "Chasing Shadows".
content.location: In Neverland, right side angling from left to up and right.

content.description: The PREMIERE dyno of Arkansas. The 5 ft one move wonder is the best in its class. A satellite of Fountain Red but definitely worth the hike if you're looking for a more challenging throw than Le Beak.
content.location: After taking a left at the cemetery sign on your way to Fountain Red, find the faint road on the left before you get to FR. Drive until you see a Road Closed sign (about 100yds) and continue on foot. After another 100yds or more, you'll see a path on your left going up hill and through some rock outcroppings. Continue up hill until you see the bluff line and continue left and up hill until the beauty of the Strickland Dyno presents itself to you.

content.description: Shares the first 4 bolts with "Back to the Feature" then angles up and slightly right. After clipping the fixed fourth bolt, head straight up into a crack feature that leads to the roof. Pull the roof to gain the easier upper head wall.
content.location: At Fern Gulley, right of the corner. Shares a start with "Back to the Feature" then angles up and slightly right. Ending right of the black streak.

content.description: Sit-start on slopers, pull a hard move off the ground to a better sloper and then climb straight up to a dirty top out.
content.location: In Neverland, left side on the left end of the detached boulder.

content.description: Sit-starts on a big ledge, work straight up past another ledge and some blocky features. Top out onto the ledge and then step across to the adjacent boulder to get down.
content.protection: Not the best landing, bring several pads.
content.location: In Neverland, furthest problem left on the right wall.

content.description: A couple of crux moves low lead to juggy climbing up an overhanging aréte before rounding the corner and continuing through moderate slab followed by a small roof just before the chains.
content.location: On the northeastern downhill face of the big detached boulder at Fern Gulley. Starts on a ledge 20 feet right of the start of “Cowell of Nocturnal.”

content.description: This route starts by climbing up into a thin and technical seam section. Engaging sections in between bolts, and no great rests make for a long and sustained route, with two roof pulls near the end. It's been brushed reasonably well since its been bolted, but it will clean up even more with traffic.
content.location: Starts 10 feet left of Back to the Feature and angles up and left toward the dihedral.

content.description: A cryptic and burly boulder problem low leads to excellent climbing on immaculate rock including a beautiful tan streaked headwall.
content.location: On the northeastern downhill face of the big detached boulder in Fern Gulley. This is the left route of the two bolted routes on the boulder. It starts on a ledge just under a faint aréte. Climbs through a small roof into a beautiful tan headwall to the anchors just below a high roof.

content.description: Start low on a flat rail, work up and left on crimpy holds. Top out onto the ledge and then step across to the detached boulder to get down.
content.location: In Neverland, on the right side. Work from the far right near the entrance, up and left.

content.description: Sit-start on slopers, pull a hard move to gain a better sloper, then traverse slopers as far right as necessary to bust a hard move to the lip and then to an easy top out.
content.location: In Neverland, left side. Starts on the left end of the detached boulder and works left to right.

content.description: Shares the crack start of "Elohim" but traverses right after the 4th bolt to gain a big sidepull feature. A roof pull leads to a cool sequence guarding the anchors at the very top of the cliff.
content.location: Left of the dihedral, shares a start with "Elohim" 5.11d (refer to either guidebook) and is the only fully bolted route on that side of the wall. Look for the glue-in bolts.

climbs.name: Back to the Feature
climbs.fa: Andrew Roepke, Chan Kin Onn, Dr. Stephen T. Mougrabi

content.description: Angling up and left, work through a technical beginning to gain the first feature, work your way to the fixed fourth bolt and be sure to clip it on your way up, then head left to the fixed fifth bolt and pull a tough lock off/mantle move to gain the base of the roof, clip the fixed 6th bolt and pull the roof to gain the overhanging upper headwall. Cruise giant features and holds past one more bolt to the anchors. Varied movement with multiple cruxes.
content.location: This route tackles the middle of the face, right of the corner/dihedral route "Yahweh". Starts above a platform of rocks to keep you and your rope out of the water puddles.

content.description: A tucked away little gulley with a very rainforest like feel. A few mixed/trad routes were established here in 1994. This area is most famous for the Strickland/Mentin Dyno. You pass through this area to get to New Font. The wall left of the dihedral stays in the shade all day, and tends to stay damp. But the wall right of the dihedral, with the bolted routes, gets morning sun until around noon. Neverland is a small corridor underneath the massive Fern Gully boulder, a small collection of boulder problems.
